text: Lucie Crain (fl. 1891), was a German women's rights activist and educator. She played a significant part in the history of women's education in Germany. She is known as the founder of the Crainschen Anstalten in Berlin, often referred to as the leading Höhere Töchternschulen (women's college) in the German Empire. == References == * Gudrun Wedel: Lehren zwischen Arbeit und Beruf. Einblicke in das Leben der Autobiographinnen im 19. Jh. Köln et al 2000, 243. Category:19th-century German educators Category:German women's rights activists
title: Lucie Crain
